intro: Merinthe, commonly known as the common merinthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Merinthe is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
